content.question: The velocity of a particle moving along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis is given by <math alttext="v of t equals, the fraction with numerator 1 minus t cubed, and denominator 1 plus t, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>v</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true about the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 1.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The acceleration is negative, and the speed is decreasing.
The acceleration is negative, and the speed is increasing.
The acceleration is positive, and the speed is decreasing.
The acceleration is positive, and the speed is increasing.

content.answer: The acceleration is negative, and the speed is increasing.

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
